para.text-1: IGCSE (International General Certificate of Secondary Education) is a two-year secondary education program designed for students aged 14 to 16. It is an internationally recognized qualification that is equivalent to the GCSE (General Certificate of Secondary Education) in the UK. The IGCSE curriculum covers a wide range of subjects, including English, Mathematics, Sciences, Humanities, and Languages. The program is designed to prepare students for further education, such as the International Baccalaureate (IB) or A-levels, or for entering the university foundation programme. Students take exams at the end of the two-year program and receive certificates based on their performance
